full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 223 of 228 899 LC2Qmax7 - corrected Alessi - Direct but involved, and she -- and we have -- I was having a lot of financial problems without a job. And I move out of my house, out of my -- my family, and I commit the greatest mistake I ever done in my life. Q. What did you do, Mr. Alessi? A. I went back to the house, and I took some money out. Q. How did you get into the house? A. Through a sliding door. Q. How could you get in? A. Through the sliding door. It was open. It was easily opened. Q. Once you got into the house, where did you go? A. I went to this -- I went directly to where this luggage bag was situated. Q. Where was that? A. By Mr. Epstein's desk. Q. Which desk? A. The lake room. Q. What did you do when you went to Mr. Epstein's desk in the lake room? A. I took a band of a hundred dollar bills. Q. About how much money did you take? A. I took -- it was $6,300. Q. After you broke into Mr. Epstein's home and stole that money, who, if anyone, contacted you? SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012508
